reviewText:
At $4, this may be the best shooter deal on Steam.

I initially misjudged the music as mostly forgettable. However, after 7 hours of play, it has really grown on me. It's well done, complex, and apporopriate. On the whole surely above average. Sound effects are nicely done as well.

The graphics are technically adequate, and artistically very nice. Enemy bullets are colorful and easily distinguished from the backgrounds. The backgrounds are nicely done and enjoyable to look at. They're not the Plain-Jane, drab work you might expect from a budget game. However, the game seems to be running at 30fps, but that's just my guess. The in-game FPS counter I have enabled in the Steam options is curiously absent from this title alone. Graphics could use a resolution bump as well. The game looks quite good in windowed mode, but a little blocky in full screen. Not too bad though. Speaking of full screen, there is no immediately apparent way to activate full screen mode. There is no options menu to be found. Pressing F11 will toggle between full screen and windowed mode. It would be nice to see a setup or options screen to adjust sound/music levels and select full screen. Or at least have some text on the main screen that says, Press F11 for full screen".

Gameplay is fluid and has a couple of interesting mechanics at work. The hit box is small and cleary defined. You choose from three charachters--red/yellow/blue. Each color has a different weapon pattern and can absorb like-colored enemy bullets (ie red bulltes do not harm the red player). Without getting into detail
date:
absorbing enemy fire benefits you. Also the trigger buttons on the 360 controller slow down the movement of your player to give you greater control to weave in and out of the more intracite waves of bullets.

Difficulty ramps up nicely after the 2nd level and the 5th and 6th level were designed to submit you.

For $4 it's a no-brainer for the shooter fan. I HIGHLY reccomend it."

reviewText:
I rate the game Gun Wings 3/5. It's ok.

This is another one of those little vertical-scrolling arcade-style action games wherein hoards of enemies fly in from the top of the screen and shoot glowing globs of stuff which you need to keep your fast moving spacecraft (or in this case, your fast moving anime girl) from bumping into while you hose the entire screen down with your own faster-moving firepower. As is normal for this genre, this is not an easy game, even when played on the easiest difficulty.

+3 Different difficulty levels.
+3 Different characters to choose from each of which have 2 different modes.
+Good menu design.
+Nice stages and enemy design.
+This game is very inexpensive.

+/-Adequate sound and music.
+/-Extremely difficult (but then nearly all games of this kind are extremely difficult).

-Why do you not have little spaceships to control? Why are you controlling little anime girls? Despite the game's attempt at an explanation this really doesn't make much sense but then, this is by no means the first game in this genre to portray flying anime girls in lieu of nifty looking spacecraft.
-I cannot resize the game's resolution and there is no menu option to play in anything other than windowed mode. This is the game's biggest problem. This means that if you are using a monitor in the now standard 1920 by 1080p resolution this game's window will be pretty small and thus all the enemies and their projectiles will be that much harder to see. This is not an extra degree of challenge which this game needs and I'm not going to resize my monitor just to suit this silly little game.

reviewText: Absolutely fine game, I like it very much since it's lightweight, can run on almost any PC, and it is very time-eating. At first when you look at the pictures and title video it isn't much, but when you start playing you immediatelly kiss good-bye to 4-5 hours since the game just forces you to keep on playing :D It's quite enjoyable due to its simplicity, and the classic graphics give you a good retro sense of the older games, at least to us veterans who remember stuff like the first Medal of Honor and such :D

reviewText:
Gun Wings is a fast paced shmup game.

Story:

The story is about three cybernetic girls who are tasked with stopping an alien invasion. It's a decent story that ties the gameplay together.

Gameplay:

The Gameplay is fast and fluid, it can be dificult at times, but it's always fair. At the end of each stage there is a boss fight, which is always diffirent and changes things up.

Graphics:

The graphics are really polished and well done, the sprites all move fluidly, and there is a variety of enemies and locations.

Music:

The Music really works with the game, it's hyper and gets you excited to play. It's good enough to listen on it's own.

Extra:

Gun Wings features trading cards, achievments, cloud support, and multiple languages support.
Conclusion:

Gun Wings is a high quality game, it has great graphics and soundtrack, it's very well worth the very cheap price of 4 dollars. I would highly recommend it!
voteText: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Okay, let me clear something up here, until I bought this game, I NEVER played a bullet hell. So I bought this game with no prior experiences with this type of game. I'm INSTANTLY addicted. About as addicted as I am to KSP, but I digress.

The game is about three cybernetic girls tasked with stopping a meteorite from hitting the Earth, which would probably cause all life as we know it to die. The controls are just fine in my opinion, and the graphics are great. Character and enemy sprites, as well as bullets, are easily distinguishable from the backgrounds, and makes the game less confusing when bullets are being fired at your character like fifteen Heavyweapons guys firing miniguns at you non-stop.

Music and sound effects are really nice and are rather relaxing for what's happening in-game while fitting with their stages nicely. On the topic of stages, each one gets progressively more difficult as you make your way through the barrage of bullets constantly headed toward your character, and there's no real difficulty spikes, which probably helps make it addicting, but I dunno.

The game is short, but I'm probably the only one who finds it a good thing, as some people might have the around 1-2 hours it can take to finish the game without taking into consideration the achievements and whatnot.

Overall, I rate it... Around a 9.8/10, because I think it SHOULD probably have one or two more stages... :P

reviewText:
First off I want to thank developer for providing a key for me to play and review the game.

Gun Wings is a decent Shmup game. Three difficulties to choose: Easy (First four stages only), Normal and Hard.

Pros:
+ Exciting BGM
+ Challenging Gameplay (the boss gets really difficult after stage 1)
+ Amusing reward after killing enemy
+ Bullet absorbing feature (Always read the info before playing, QAQ)
+ Cheap~

Cons:
- Lack of story
- Get you addicted :P



Improvements can be made:
- Some BGM, SFX can be added after beating a stage and score count.
- Keyboard control is a bit less precise on movement than mouse control. It will be more handy if we can move character with mouse.
- Seems like the place on the right of the screen is reserved for Player 2. I'll be looking forward to play this with my friend.
- The cursor is under the building picture layer at the main screen, gotta fix that~
- The game info" menu disappear if you move the cursor out of the button. The arrow button at top right corner for background story page is never accessible unless you press -> on key board.

P.S:  Kou's weapon 2 (the pink tracing bomb) makes me kind of dizzy because of the blinking (red and blue). Developer informed.    :)"

reviewText: It's only 4 stages long but it has three cute girls and tons of replaybility. Highly recommend you guys get it. One of the better Touhou Bullet Hell type of games on Steam. Already finished the whole thing with Blue Girl, gonna try Yellow Girl next, then Red Girl last.  Gorgeous art, great controls, and good music to top it off. Coming from a Touhou fan let me say that this game is a straight up 10/10!\n\nEdit: If you play 'easy mode' it only has four stages, but if you play 'normal mode' it offers even more, not to mention there's also 'hard mode'. Overall if you like bullet hell games this one is a must.
